column1: Bleeding gums can be a sign that you have or are at risk for gum disease.
- Control gum bleeding by applying pressure directly on the gums with a gauze pad soaked in ice water.
- See your dentist if your dentures or other dental appliances do not fit well or are causing sore spots on your gums.
Consult your health care provider if: - The bleeding is severe or long term (chronic) - Your gums continue to bleed even after treatment - You have other unexplained symptoms with the bleeding
